title: Customer Accounts & Authentication
intent: Enable customers to securely log in, see personalized data, and manage their subscription.

title: Design customer account model
description: Define the schema for customers including email, name, hashed password, subscription hours, and scheduling permissions.

title: Implement authentication UI
description: Add login, logout, and registration UI on thehousefinch.com.
acceptance: Users can log in and log out

title: Secure customer API endpoints
description: Protect backend endpoints so only authenticated users can fetch their own subscription hours and appointments.
acceptance: Authenticated user sees only their data

title: Banked Hours Tracking
intent: Track purchased and consumed hours for customers and reflect balance in UI.

title: Build banked hours ledger
description: Implement backend logic to track hours purchased, hours consumed by appointments, and remaining balance.

title: Display balance in customer dashboard
description: Show remaining hours in the logged-in customer’s dashboard.

title: Web Scheduling Interface
intent: Allow customers to select appointment times and durations based on their available hours.

title: Design scheduling calendar UI
description: Create a calendar component where customers can choose available dates and times.

title: Integrate scheduling with hours ledger
description: Prevent booking times that exceed the customer’s available hours.
acceptance: Cannot book more hours than available

title: Persist bookings in database
description: Store each booking with customer ID, time, and duration.

title: Staff Notification System
intent: Notify House Finch staff when a booking is created, modified, or canceled.

title: Choose notification channels
description: Decide whether to use email, SMS, or dashboard alerts for staff.

title: Implement notification dispatch
description: Send notifications when appointments are scheduled or changed.

title: Payments & Purchasing More Hours
intent: Enable customers to buy additional hours easily through the website.

title: Integrate payment processor
description: Connect Stripe or another payment provider for purchasing hours.

title: Credit hours after purchase
description: Add purchased hours to customer’s banked balance automatically.

title: Staff Dashboard
intent: Provide internal view for House Finch staff to manage schedules and view customer balances.

title: Design dashboard UI
description: Create a dashboard showing upcoming appointments and customer info.

title: Implement staff view endpoints
description: Create backend endpoints for staff to retrieve all bookings and balances.

title: Replace Connecteam for Scheduling Workflows
intent: Retire reliance on Connecteam for customer scheduling and hours tracking.

title: Audit current Connecteam workflows
description: Map how scheduling and notifications currently work in Connecteam.

title: Migrate scheduling off Connecteam
description: Stop using Connecteam for core customer scheduling features.

title: Backlog Visualization (Read-Only, AI-Driven)
intent: Provide a non-technical, read-only visualization of the Beads backlog while maintaining backlog.jsonl as the sole source of truth.

title: Define visualization goals and constraints
description: Clarify requirements for visualizing the backlog, including hierarchical epic→issue display, read-only access, and prohibition of manual edits.

title: Decide on static-site approach for backlog visualization
description: Evaluate and select a static-site-based approach (e.g., GitHub Pages) for rendering the backlog without requiring runtime services.

title: Define hierarchical backlog presentation model
description: Specify how epics and issues are grouped and displayed, including ordering, status indicators, and issue counts per epic.

title: Define stakeholder-facing UX for backlog viewer
description: Describe how less technical users will navigate and understand the backlog, including expand/collapse behavior and explanatory copy.
acceptance: Purpose of backlog explained in UI

title: Define workflow for agent-driven backlog updates
description: Document how agents are prompted to update backlog.jsonl and how changes propagate to the visualization.

title: Define CI/CD trigger model for backlog visualization updates
description: Specify when and how backlog visualization updates are generated from backlog.jsonl changes.

title: Define governance rules preventing manual backlog edits
description: Establish guardrails (policy, documentation, or automation) that discourage or block humans from editing backlog.jsonl directly.

title: Beads Configuration & Agent Guardrails
intent: Add repository-level Beads configuration and documentation so new agent sessions quickly understand backlog guardrails, workflow, and context.

title: Define Beads operating rules for this repo
description: Specify the rules agents must follow when working with beads/backlog.jsonl (append-only, preserve format, unique IDs, no reordering, no human edits).
acceptance: Rules documented in a dedicated config/doc location
Explicitly states humans should not directly edit backlog.jsonl
Rules include append-only and no rewrite/reorder constraints

title: Create agent prompt template for backlog changes
description: Provide a reusable prompt template that includes instructions to paste the full backlog.jsonl as context and requires the agent to output only new JSONL lines to append.
acceptance: Template instructs to include full backlog.jsonl as context
Template requires output of only new JSONL lines
Template includes rules for unique IDs and matching existing format

title: Document backlog item format and ID conventions
description: Document the canonical JSONL shapes for epics and issues, required/optional fields, and ID naming conventions (EPIC-N, ISSUE-N.M).
acceptance: ID convention documented and consistent with existing items

title: Add lightweight project context for new agents
description: Add a short context doc describing The House Finch goals, key epics, and how the backlog relates to the website scheduling/subscription system.
acceptance: Context explains customer goals (schedule, view hours, buy more)
Context is short and optimized for agent onboarding

title: Define process for proposing new backlog items
description: Establish the standard workflow: request → agent generates JSONL lines → PR created → merge triggers visualization update (if applicable).
acceptance: Includes where to put new lines (append)

title: Define backlog validation requirements
description: Specify validation rules that tools/agents must uphold (valid JSON per line, required fields, unique IDs, referenced epic exists for issues).
acceptance: Includes ID uniqueness and epic reference integrity
